snippet.textDisplay:
Seriously. Why are we making videos like this? This topic was a nightmare. How do you talk about a continent as diverse as Africa, to explain larger trends? Not only is there a wide variety of sources, experts disagree with each other on what they can predict about the future. So the time we took to rewrite this script over and over was insane.


Still, there is no chance this video won’t make people angry, on all sides of this issue. Some may not agree with the conclusions we have come to. Some will think there are other aspects we could and should have mentioned. Or lament that we generalized too much.


But we had to generalize or this video would just have become a hour-long documentary. And we think the topic is too important to not discuss it.


So we read a lot and talked too many experts with very different opinions and interpretations. Also we tried to prepare our sources in a way that walks you through our thought process and helps you to make up your own mind.


This video was sponsored by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation as part of a Grant. They did not take part in the production of the video though.


Sources and comments: https://sites.google.com/view/sourcesoverpopulationandafrica

Still, there is no chance this video won’t make people angry, on all sides of this issue. Some may not agree with the conclusions we have come to. Some will think there are other aspects we could and should have mentioned. Or lament that we generalized too much. 


But we had to generalize or this video would just have become a hour-long documentary. And we think the topic is too important to not discuss it.

snippet.textDisplay:
This video fails to mention 2 important things:

1. The reason the African population exploded is because the west has poured trillions of dollars of foreign aid into the third-world for several decades. When you give third-worlders more food, they just have more kids. This has brought hundreds of millions of people into existence who would not exist if it weren't for government intervention, a population artificially above where it would be naturally that now needs permanent, continued reception of said aid lest a great many people die.

2. Most if not all the African countries are run by socialists/communists due to Russia spreading communism through the third-world. Africa is not a bastion of free market capitalism. African countries have lots of central planning of the economy and are economically way left of the US. They can't flourish because they're broken by economic leftism.

snippet.textDisplay:
Over population only happens in view of psichologically stable life enviroment.
Meaning the amount of manpower and the amount of landmass for that manpower to support theire standardized needs goes over our allocation and logistical capabilities.

A very good way to imagine.

Imagine you want to put street lights over a dessert road. Imagine how many electrician would you need for that to happen, and maintain, imagine how much room you would need for all theire housing, how much parking space you would need for all theire cars, and you can go on and on and on, and the amount of space and requirements needed for a more and more developed individual you realize no matter how big earth is the amount of landmass is just not enough.

Thats why automation, artifical food, technology in preserving and transportation contributes as much as a condome.

snippet.textDisplay:
Bangladesh was created in 1971 when India liberated it from the Pakistan army. I think you mean east Pakistan.

I disagree with what has been mentioned in your video about the measures taken in 1960s

In 1960s East Pakistan (now Bangladesh) was mainly controlled from the west pakistan (now pakistan) and they didn't have any independence of policy making. They couldn't even use their own language (Bengali) and Urdu was imposed on them by west pakistan. I believe the changes that you mentioned happened because post 1971 the destiny of the Bangladeshis was finally in their own hands, and the govt of sheikh mujib-ur Rehman took lots of policies to improve the human capital of the country.

snippet.textDisplay:
The link of bitrate to poverty is a pernicious wrong headed thing IMHO. I mean what are we doing here - trading children for economic growth?
all the countries that had lower birth rates have massive demographic problems now. For example, in Japan there are now more adult diapers sold than infant diapers. China is nearly there and USA and Europe are also on the precipice. We need children, lots of them. In families don’t actually have kids then the world will stagnate. I accept that it is a complex thing but please stop making assumptions like women want less children (perhaps it is families that want less?) and stop with the language that implies children are some some of parasite on the world. If it comes to sacrificing an age group for prosperity then why make it those that are not yet born?
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
You're spot on when you say Africa doesn't need gifts, they need education.
I have been travelling in west Africa for 6 months and every day i see so much potential for africa to be a booming economy.
Education is absolutely a critical early step in this future transition but i think the first which needs to happen is a huge change in attitude from Africa's people and unity among African states. Its heart breaking seeing people so divided by lines drawn in the sand by colonial powers who left the continent decades ago...
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
4:44 "young nations were often ethnically heterogenous and lacked unity"

Dictionary: The adjective heterogenous is a somewhat comparative word, suggesting that two or more things are unlike in substance or nature, as in a heterogenous mixture containing two substances that do not totally combine, like oil and water.

So, the author admits diversity erodes national unity as different cultures aren't compatible with one another. Interesting.
snippet.textOriginal:
4:44 "young nations were often ethnically heterogenous and lacked unity"

Dictionary: The adjective heterogenous is a somewhat comparative word, suggesting that two or more things are unlike in substance or nature, as in a heterogenous mixture containing two substances that do not totally combine, like oil and water.

So, the author admits diversity erodes national unity as different cultures aren't compatible with one another. Interesting.

snippet.textDisplay: "...wracked by civil wars, military conflicts, unstable governments..." That's one way to paper over neocolonialism. I guess those things just happened naturally, not because exploitation of Africa by global hegemons has continued unabated. Money from the Gates foundation (<-- literal neocolonialist) has hurt whatever ethical integrity these videos used to have, and they've been reduced to cringy, misleading, imperialist pablum. Think about it, this video was so uncritical it could've ended with "...and that's why we should use the power of the US military to bring everyone in Africa freedom and prosperity, like we did in Iraq!" without betraying its own internal consistency. That sucks.

snippet.textDisplay: How large should the world population become - bearing in mind the spread of humanity has cost a massive loss of megafauna (90% of species over 45kg gone from Australia, 75% The Americas, 35% Europe, and - until now - only 5% in Africa). Are there already too many humans on the planet?
snippet.textOriginal: How large should the world population become - bearing in mind the spread of humanity has cost a massive loss of megafauna (90% of species over 45kg gone from Australia, 75% The Americas, 35% Europe, and - until now - only 5% in Africa). snippet.textDisplay: An issue rarely discussed when addressing the issue of overpopulation is the tradition of parents using children as a form of 'pension plan'. Many have a large number of children in order to ensure that they can be assured that at least one can care for them in later life. Although this wouldn't exactly solve the population issue, it could help if greater investment was put into caring for the elderly. It could give the impression that there is less of a need to have so many children and would free up those already born to contribute more to the economy, helping to increase development.
snippet.textOriginal: An issue rarely discussed when addressing the issue of overpopulation is the tradition of parents using children as a form of 'pension plan'. Many have a large number of children in order to ensure that they can be assured that at least one can care for them in later life. Although this wouldn't exactly solve the population issue, it could help if greater investment was put into caring for the elderly. It could give the impression that there is less of a need to have so many children and would free up those already born to contribute more to the economy, helping to increase development.

snippet.textDisplay: Fake fear mongering racist depopulation news! Africa isn't over populated. It has less people than China and India. Bill Gates is the devil and a sociopath.
snippet.textOriginal: Fake fear mongering racist depopulation news! Africa isn't over populated. It has less people than China and India. Bill Gates is the devil and a sociopath.

snippet.textDisplay: Funny how this was sponsored by the Gates foundation; and funnier enough is the fact that there is 1 billion each in India and China alone (countries), but there's an issue with overpopulation concerning an entire CONTINENT. Africa, which has and is still being systematically demoralized, exploitated, and annihilated of its resources and people. The fact is Western countries and their use of destabilizing the climate is a far better issue to cry about. This is not whataboutism, but the fact remains that only grassroot organizations implemented by the people themseleves without the insertion of Western NGO'S is the best and only solution. If anything Africa is underpopulated and maybe if people would hold 'peace treaty organizations' like the UN accountable ("in Benin: groups of nations at the United Nations, looking after mining monopolies have been caught using UN Peace Keepers as a buffer to allow multinationals steal resources. The UN so-called peace keepers were exposed for smuggling coltan.") Having regurgitated 'discourses' that really just cement mainstream thought with no concrete measures on why, how, the history of how once again external nations insert themselves (using aid money to put african countries in a cycle of poverty and debt, etc), and really who is at the table discussing all this is why Africa is in the state it's in. Let the U.S. and western nations start from its very own table, since once again climate change is the far pressing matter at hand. Speaking as an African that grew up in the U.S.

snippet.textDisplay:
Anyone who thinks that higher levels of social standards/wealth = lower birth rate is wrong, it’s a cultural thing.
Modern individualistic liberal societies where it’s expensive and unrewarding to raise children lowers birthrates.
Germany during the 30s saw an increase in both wealth, living standards and birth rates.

snippet.textDisplay:
Yes, this was going to be a sensitive topic no matter what. I'm from Kenya and in a nutshell, agree with everything said.

I understand the need to generalise and give approximates because honestly not even an hour is enough time to get through all the specifics.

Objectively speaking, there shouldn't be any outrage towards this video of any kind. This video was a starting point to a conversation we (for those it concerns and would like to make it their concern) should be having.

Great job.

snippet.textDisplay:
If you don't want to make an hour-long video, but tell us to basically spend at least an hour looking at your sources, why bother making the video at all? Just give us a reading-list ffs.

You are certainly aware that almost nobody here is going to look at the sources, yet you decide put the video out there, despite even acknowledging that it will make a lot of people angry because of its shortcomings. This looks to me like nothing but a cash-grab.

Your research is pretty much worthless, if all your video does is lead to people believe they know more about a topic than they actually do, especially when it comes to such sensitive topics. It has been shown that people reliably over-estimate their knowledge of a topic after watching so-called "informative" videos. You must be aware of this. I'm virtually certain that you are.
snippet.textOriginal:
If you don't want to make an hour-long video, but tell us to basically spend *at least* an hour looking at your sources, why bother making the video at all? Just give us a reading-list ffs.

You are certainly aware that almost nobody here is going to look at the sources, yet you decide put the video out there, despite even acknowledging that it will make a lot of people angry because of its shortcomings. This looks to me like nothing but a cash-grab.

Your research is pretty much worthless, if all your video does is lead to people believe they know more about a topic than they actually do, especially when it comes to such sensitive topics. It has been shown that people reliably over-estimate their knowledge of a topic after watching so-called "informative" videos. You *must* be aware of this. I'm virtually certain that you are.

snippet.textDisplay:
Fact: South Korea was the first country to apply population control by power countries in exchange for helping the countries develop, that is why the number of kids per a family changed.

Family planning back then after 1950 means population control to poor countries (maybe rich countries were scared of too many poor).

I agree that a lot of countries need though, but not to an extend that population in countries decline.

snippet.textDisplay:
How would it be like in an alternate timeline if both women and men are only able to have kids from ages 20 to 40 and aren't able to have kids anymore after age 40? And if women could only have up to 4 kids in their lifetimes and aren't able to have anymore than 4?
Also, what would it be like if human babies had heads as small as their bodies at birth(so they can easily fit through the birth canals) and are already fully-developed and could easily sit up, crawl, walk, run, eat, talk, think, and remember everything from birth onwards?
Also, what if every human's lifespan is from ages 0 to 60? With childhood from ages 0 to 10, adolescence from 10 to 20, young-adulthood from 20 to 30, mature-adulthood from 30 to 40, middle-age from 40 to 50, and old age from 50 to 60? And then if every human dies naturally of old age at 60 years old and aren't able to live beyond that age, even with modern or futuristic medicine?
So in conclusion, how would human history have changed from prehistoric times to modern day Thursday, December 19, 2019 at 6:27 PM? How many people would there have been today? What would it be like living in that alternate reality? Does anybody know?
snippet.textOriginal:
How would it be like in an alternate timeline if both women and men are only able to have kids from ages 20 to 40 and aren't able to have kids anymore after age 40? And if women could only have up to 4 kids in their lifetimes and aren't able to have anymore than 4? 
    Also, what would it be like if human babies had heads as small as their bodies at birth(so they can easily fit through the birth canals) and are already fully-developed and could easily sit up, crawl, walk, run, eat, talk, think, and remember everything from birth onwards?
    Also, what if every human's lifespan is from ages 0 to 60? With childhood from ages 0 to 10, adolescence from 10 to 20, young-adulthood from 20 to 30, mature-adulthood from 30 to 40, middle-age from 40 to 50, and old age from 50 to 60? And then if every human dies naturally of old age at 60 years old and aren't able to live beyond that age, even with modern or futuristic medicine? 
     So in conclusion, how would human history have changed from prehistoric times to modern day Thursday, December 19, 2019 at 6:27 PM? How many people would there have been today? What would it be like living in that alternate reality? Does anybody know?

You are not equipped to handle topics like this. Being funded by Gates makes them even more laughable, a man who has been quite clear and PUSHING the idea that Africa is overpopulate. Its absolutely disgusting. And that’s your bias right there. Africa isn’t in poverty due to overpopulation like Gates seems to believe. Africa is in poverty because of racism and greed. Coulda stopped your analysis at the 5:00 mark, PERIODT.

snippet.textDisplay: This is low key anti black since Asia in particular India and China have just as large if not larger population than sub saharan Africa. Also population is declining in Europe and in the Americas so it evens out. I am very suspicious of Bill Gates types "concerned" about over population as it pertains to black people

snippet.textDisplay:
Hello, I'm a new fan, i really love ur videos and the topics you bring on. You guys are now part of my daily routine, i get to watch ur videos when i get back from school to entertain myself and learn new stuff at the same time. Thank you for that.


I was wondering if you could make a video about Langages, how are there so many languages around the world? How have they been developed ? What led to this huge diversity of languages ?
